Text.Value: It is, rather. Master Lorroakan has us keep it to a high standard.
He's the most powerful wizard in Baldur's Gate. And I am his apprentice.

EditorData.NodeContext: A bit subdued and defeated while masking that with a normal cadence.

Text.Value: True enough. You didn't kill them - just left them to die in that godforsaken tower.
Welcome to Sorcerous Sundries, where every item carries the personal guarantee of Lorroakan, Immortal Master of Ramazith's Tower. How can I help you?
There's even a pamphlet. Take one - they're on the desk.

EditorData.NodeContext: gestures directly in front of him - to the counter

Text.Value: Who's Lorroakan?
Perhaps. I stopped by many huts and hamlets on my way here. Master Lorroakan invited me to be his apprentice.

EditorData.NodeContext: A bit subdued and defeated while masking that with a normal cadence.

Text.Value: That man outside seemed quite irate.
Did you see Aradin outside? From the druid's grove?
I'm surprised you're behind the counter, and not up in the tower.
That isn't your concern.

EditorData.NodeContext: player has asked what happened to rolan's face. He has to switch gears form furious, to defensive. Stuuters a little, looks away angrily.

Text.Value: Be very sure before you make to visit Lorroakan. He's got a beastly temper.

EditorData.NodeContext: sounds a little dissapointed in the player

Text.Value: Sorry, I'll leave you in peace.
I'm here for sorcerous sundries, of course.
Me? What are you doing here?
I'd like to buy something.
Head upstairs to find the way into his tower. But be careful - mistakes are always punished around here.
Leave.
I have information on the Nightsong. I want to speak to Lorroakan.
I suppose that, at least, I can help with.
If you insist on making a purchase, hurry up and do it.
How can I help you?
But never mind that. What can I do for you?

EditorData.NodeContext: uncomofrtable, trying to be cheery and professional

Text.Value: I'll see what you have on offer, then.
I should hope not. After you left Cal and Lia to die, I never want to see your face again.
Of course - but Master Lorroakan has yet to share the fruits of our labour with me. Apparently I'm 'not ready'.

EditorData.NodeContext: slightly annoyed, emphasis on 'our'. Clearly unhappy.

Text.Value: I know you're upset about Cal and Lia, but I didn't kill them.
You look a bit worse for wear. What happened to your face?
A lucky escape, given Lorroakan's reputation. He'd have little of value to teach you.
I know the marks of subjugation. Your face - what happened?
'Immortal'? So caging Nightsong went well?
Please, just make your purchase and go. I don't have energy for anything else.
You. What do you want?

EditorData.NodeContext: looks up, sees player - utterly furious

Text.Value: Did you see Aradin outside? From the druid's grove?
I heard this was the place for spellcasting prodigies - why are you here?
Aye. We had to remove him from the premises, but unfortunately we couldn't stop him from being a nuisance just outside.

EditorData.NodeContext: sigh, talking about aradin who caused hassle in the shop earlier

Text.Value: Leave.
You. Get out. Now.

EditorData.NodeContext: looks up, sees player - utterly furious

Text.Value: *His voice catches. Something's wrong here.*
It has not been what I expected. Master Lorroakan is... a difficult man.
Leave.
If you've got information, Master Lorroakan will want to speak to you immediately. He speaks of almost nothing else than the Nightsong's retrieval.
And this is where I shall stay, apparently. Immortality has not improved Master Lorroakan's temperament.
It's all I deal with these days - people claiming their trinkets are the 'real Nightsong', looking for the mountain of gold Lorroakan promised.

EditorData.NodeContext: annoyed, rolling eyes - thinks the nightsong is a wild goosechase

Text.Value: I know Nightsong, actually. Or did at least.
Then head upstairs. And be careful - something terrible might happen if you're not paying attention.

EditorData.NodeContext: frustrated, doesn't want to be speaking to the player

Text.Value: Master Lorroakan has a contract out to any idiot with legs to find the Nightsong. Aradin is one such idiot.
Hope you found what you're looking for.

EditorData.NodeContext: A little defeated but still cheerful

Text.Value: Leave.
But if you really do know something, he'll want to see you. Head upstairs - you can find the way into his tower up there.
How can I help you?
I want to speak to whoever's in charge around here.
I might be here about Nightsong.
It's good to see you too, Rolan.
Nightsong? She's in my camp right now.
I have no peace - not anymore.
Let me see what's on offer.
This is my 'apprenticeship'.
You want to buy something? Buy it. Then get out.
I know the marks of subjugation. Your face - what happened?
You look familiar. Were you in the druid's grove?
This is a beautiful shop.
You must be here to shop. I am sundries, while Tolna deals with tomes.

EditorData.NodeContext: A bit subdued and defeated while masking that with a normal cadence.

Text.Value: Cal thought this would be everything I wanted. He always was an optimist.

EditorData.NodeContext: verklempt, thinking of his sister wistfully

Text.Value: Calm down, Rolan. I'm not here for you.
I've heard rumours about Lorroakan's 'teaching'. Or lack of it. His students are no more than glorified shopkeeps.
I know a beating when I see one. Who knocked you about?
Do many people ask about the Nightsong?
Nothing for you to worry about.

EditorData.NodeContext: player has asked about his face (master lorroakan hurt him, but he doesn't want to say).

Text.Value: *His voice catches. There's more going on here than meets the eye.*
What?

EditorData.NodeContext: last thing he wants, in the entire world, is to be speaking to the player right now

Text.Value: I'm his apprentice. In addition to attending to the shop, I'll one day enter his tutelage.
Gods - what happened to your face?
Lia suspected it might be this way. She was a pain, but she was always right.

EditorData.NodeContext: verklempt, thinking of his sister wistfully

Text.Value: He's consumed by his pursuit of the Nightsong. I haven't learnt a thing and I fear it'll stay that way.
I know a beating when I see one. Who knocked you about?
Be quick about it.
Nightsong? She's in my camp right now.
I'd like to buy something.
I know a beating when I see one. Who knocked you about?
I have to ask - what happened to your face?
Welcome back. How can I assist?
I'd like to buy something.
I look forward to seeing it.
Can't blame him for taking Lorroakan's contract to retrieve the Nightsong. There's a fortune on offer, and so far no one's been able to claim it.
Rolan. How are you faring without Cal and Lia?
Or... are you perhaps another 'adventurer' with information on the 'Nightsong'?

EditorData.NodeContext: A bit subdued and defeated while masking that with a normal cadence.

Text.Value: Leave.
I know Nightsong, actually. Or knew her, at least.
I want to speak to whoever's in charge around here.
Don't worry about it.
Sure. Head on upstairs. Though do be warned, if you don't bring something called the 'Nightsong' with you, your head will be put through a window.
Leave.
Gods, what happened to your face?
Life goes on, doesn't it. Whether you want it to or not.
You must be mistaken. The Nightsong is a relic - something quite ancient, to hear Master Lorroakan talk.

EditorData.NodeContext: surprised, can't believe the nightsong is a person, and that she's with payer

Text.Value: I'm just here to shop.
I have information on the Nightsong.
You. What are you doing here?
I know the marks of subjugation. Your face - what happened?

Synopsis: Dialog with Sorcerous Sundries' clerk Rolan. He will explain how Lorroakan is neglecting him in his search for the Nightsong. Player can ask Rolan to make a portal to Lorroakan.
